reviewText: It's true! This cable outperforms the original! When I charge my phone, it's chargier. The data is more datery and the phone is more phoney in general. If I wear the cable around my neck like a bolo tie, people like me better and I can run faster and jump higher.  If I circle my dinner plate with it, the food tastes better. reviewText: This is clearly not a HTC cable as it has the Blackberry logo on it and the bulk packaging label says Blackberry...but it's a OEM micro usb cable none the less and works perfectly on any micro usb device I plugged it into.While I haven't tested it's speed against other cables I doubt it outperforms any other OEM cable but it works and that's all I asked for of it.The cable is a bit thick and as a result is stiff but not unmanageably so.It should also be noted that the cable shown in the picture is not of the actual product, that is a mini usb cable and appears to be quite a bit longer than the product, this cable is 1m long.

reviewText: First let me say this works fine when connecting standard headphones to my HTC made "Verizon Wireless SMT5800" (model number LIBR100), clear audio quality, I would say better then bluetooth stereo quality wise so no degradation of the signal.The first hitch is the size, my phone's a couple inches long and this adapter effectively doubles the length. I really underestimated the size when looking at a picture but it's manageable.Then it has a quirk where if you disconnect the headphones while the adapter is connected to the phone you have to unplug the adapter again or it wont read the headphones when you plug them back it, upon plugging them back in it triggers the voice command prompt for some reason, I am not sure if this is a problem with the adapter or with the windows mobile on my phone.Other then the above two notes this product works fine, ordered it so I could use my phone as a mp3 player on a upcoming flight since my bluetooth headphones would not be a option and I see no reason it will not work.

reviewerName: Jaffrey W. Ali "Relentless Pursuit of Technology"
reviewText: This is a very good quality product. Probably not great for mobile use since it is a little bulky but it is indeed ideal as a charging station for something like the tilt where you can see the screen and use this connector to both charge the device and use the audio out jack. It is pretty much like an ipod cradle. I find the audio out from my Tilt to be superior to my itouch with my tilt connected to this adapter and the itouch to the apple cradle. Unexpected but true! The sound from the tilt + this adapter seems more dynamic to me.Also, the price is excellent.
title: HTC Multifunction Audio Adapter for HTC Touch T-Mobile G1 Shadow II Wing Sprint Mogul AT&T Tilt

reviewText: Cannot get audio out from the 3.5 connection. I tried several standard headphones. More so, when plugged in, the phone starts auto-dialing last dialed numbered.I spent quite a lot of time trying to understand how I can make it work. Searching and reading over the Web taught me that it is no slam dunk. 2.5 and 3.5 connectors can be wired in a number of different ways and support mono, stereo, mic, etc. There are plugs with 1, 2 and 3 rings (respectively with 2, 3 and 4 connectors - the connector is the metal part between the rings).However this is HTC part meant to work with my HTC Mogul Sprint phone - and it doesn't. My conclusion so far is that this adapter came with some short of a defect or a 'short' in its wiring though my empirical tests are not conclusive. For example, I can get mono audio out by plugging in a telephone headset into the 2.5 connection. The weird thing is that if I plug my stereo standard 3.5 headphone into that same connection (using another 2.5 to 3.5 adapter) I do not get audio.After many frustrating hours I came up with one workaround that works - plug an earphone into the proprietary port and check for sound, then plug another one in the 2.5 and test and then plug -slowly- the 3.5 in - this gets me audio out and then I can unplug the other two.I just returned mine and ordered another from the same vendor. I hope the part was defective; I shudder to think that is how it is supposed to work or that there is a problem with the phone itself.
title: HTC Multifunction Audio Adapter for HTC Touch T-Mobile G1 Shadow II Wing Sprint Mogul AT&T Tilt

reviewText: IT WORKED AWESOME I LIKED HAVING EXTRA BATTERIES CHARGED READY TO GO WHEN ONE RAN OUT I JUST SWAP IT OUT
title: HTC OEM DREA160 BATTERY FOR T-MOBILE GOOGLE G1

reviewText: My G1 had started to suffer from terrible battery performance.  I wasn't even getting half a day with average use and it was taking around 8 or 9 hours to get a full charge, which wasn't right.  I noticed that my batter was bulging and not flat, so when I would lay it on a flat surface, it would rock a little bit.  So I decided to get a new battery and found this one at a decent price.I gotta say, it works great.  Battery life is back to what it was when my phone was new.  I can get two days out of it with light use...and about a day and a half with normal use and about  a full day with heavy use.  And when I charge it, it charges MUCH quicker than before.Good enough for me.  You have to get at least a full day out of your battery with heavy use for a phone to be functional.  Charging it overnight isn't a big deal and I'm good to go for the entire next day without worrying about draining my battery to zero.I recommend this battery for all G1 users experiencing degraded battery performance.
title: HTC OEM DREA160 BATTERY FOR T-MOBILE GOOGLE G1

reviewText: As advertised, an actual HTC battery.  Seems to work great, and at a very good price.  You'll really need this extra battery with a G1 phone, for sure.
title: HTC OEM DREA160 BATTERY FOR T-MOBILE GOOGLE G1

reviewText: As other have stated the battery doesn't appear to be brand new, since it comes in a little plastic bag.That's the main reason I waited a couple of months to post a review. I wanted to tested first.The battery is performing as it was brand new and that's what it matters to me.I am able to go the entire day without charging the phone, I used to walk around looking for outlets.It even lasts a couple of days if I just use the phone to make calls and send text messages.I cannot tell the difference between a $40 battery from T-Mobile store and this one, which costs a lot less.
title: HTC OEM DREA160 BATTERY FOR T-MOBILE GOOGLE G1

reviewText: I ordered a backup battery for my HTC/T-Mobile G1 from CCMACCESSORIES and the battery is identical to the original that came with my phone. Battery works as expected and CCMACCESSORIES had fast shipping.

reviewText: I got this for $7 for my Droid Incredible and it works great. For $7 I had pretty low expectations and they have been exceeded.Be sure to re-calibrate your phone for a new battery, especially if you are going from 1300 to 1500 as I was.  You can find directions for this on xda-developers.com.

reviewText: Due to the price, I was hesitant. After using this battery for several days, it seems to function almost as well as the factory battery. At this price, you could buy several more for what you'd pay for a single battery at most retail locations. I'd buy another one if needed.
title: HTC Standard Battery for HTC XV6175, Imagio, and Hero - CDMA

reviewText: I purchased 2 of these for my Incredible.  These appear to be authentic HTC OEM batteries - not 3rd party batteries - and seem to be of high quality.  As another reviewer mentioned, these are a bit thicker and heavier than the stock battery (about 1/2 mm thicker and 30 or so % heavier).  The back of the phone takes a little bit more force to click into place as a result, no big deal.  The fit and weight do improve the feel of the phone in my opinion - it feels more solid to me.  Some may not like this though - so ymmv.As for battery life, it seems solid.  I feel like I get about 25% more life then I did with the stock battery and about the same as the Seido 1750 (which is a lot more money).  As anyone who uses one of these android devices knows, battery life can vary a lot depending on use and a bunch of different factors, so again this will depend as well.  Idle, these things will last a couple of days.  GPS Navigation on, a couple of hours.  But as I said all in all, seems like about 25% increase from stock.All in all, these are excellent batteries for the money and I highly recommend it as a spare or replacement.
title: HTC Standard Battery for HTC XV6175, Imagio, and Hero - CDMA

reviewText: My HTC Hero kept dying so I got two of these. But then I realized I should just get a new phone, which I eventually did. But these two batteries helped me a lot in the meantime.

reviewText: I got my old HTC incredible 3 years ago and the old case was starting to loosen up. It comes off when I take it out of my jeans pocket. This new one just stays in place. The only thing I would have liked is it could be a little thinner, although this works ok.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: Purchased this HTC Incredible case from Accessory One.  Fit and finish are good, the rubber case fits snugly around the phone.  Rubber case is a good thickness, enough to protect the phone but not too bulky at the same time.  The case is pretty good about not slipping off when pulling out of pockets (but it does once in a while if it gets snagged).  Case feels smooth, and not at all sticky like some rubber finishes.  All I/O ports on phone are easily accessible (other reviewers who state otherwise purchased a different case), case does not block any ports or openings on the phone.  Overall, very pleased with this case and with the price point.  HTC Incredible owners should put this case on their short list.Update 7/24/10:  After using this case for several months now, I am still happy with the fit of the case (fits snugly around phone still) and it has saved my phone from damage on many occasions already.  The one thing that has been a bit annoying though, is that the rubber gets snagged in many of my khaki pant pockets.  When you hold the case in your hand, it feels smooth, but for some reason when it comes into contact with cloth material, it gets snagged easily.  Still, I think this case is a great value for the price ($5?) so if you're looking for a cheap case, this is a good one.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: For a 2 dollar cover, I can't find any deal breaking faults. It is VERY SLIGHTLY small on the sides, where the cover doesn't completely align, but that isn't a huge deal. It still protects my phone from drops, has the openings for my charger and headphone jack, and the material has a nice smooth silicone-rubbery feel. Previously I used an Otterbox, but I found it made my phone 2x as thick in my pocket. Switching to this, I sacrifice some protection, but it's not nearly as bulky.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: It a basic skin case that fits really well on the phone. The only knock against it so far that when trying to put it on one of the corners split. Now just waiting on how long it will take before it falls apart.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: It work great ,it is good for helping to protecting your phone, iam happy with it and it work good
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: Makes the Incredible pretty bulky. The silicon gets stretched out and doesn't easily slide into my pocket. I'm going to look for another case, most likely a hard case.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: This case was a nice case. Too bad a didn't protect the phone from the owner. But the case itself was super nice.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: Case came in a plastic bag and looked a bit deformed, but the case fits snugly. My only problem is that it attracts dust all around and in the edges as well after being in my pocket, and is hard to get rid of. But for the price, it's a really good and affordable case.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: This silicone case provides protection of the camera and prevents the screen from touching a surface it's placed on.  It is matte and offers some extra grip if the phone is set down, but it's not an overly strong grip.The mic, lanyard, volume, speakerphone, power, and camera holes are appropriately placed and sized.  The earpiece cutout seems to be 1mm or so too high, but does not impair functionality.The USB cutout is large enough to easily accommodate the charging cable without being too large.  However, on mine it looks like someone ripped off some extra silicone that was left when the cover was created, so it looks slightly damaged.  This looks to be mainly cosmetic damage.It seems that on the sides of the case in the middle of the phone is not tight enough to keep a proper grip on the phone.  This makes it look like the phone is bulging out a bit on the sides.  This is probably the biggest issue I have with this silicone case.Taking the phone in and out of your pocket is made slightly more difficult and delicate because of the case.Despite the problems, it is worth the price, but no more.  It's adequate, but I'm still looking out for something with better quality that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: The case is easy to put on, seems to protect the phone well but collects pocket lint like a lint brush.  I have had this type of case before so I knew it would happen.  I am satisfied with it overall.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: You knew it when you bought it:This case is silicone and it will easily last you a year.  I bought this about 13 months ago, and the "shine" is getting dull where I've held the phone for countless hours.  What can you expect though? Even if I got rid of it because of this slight appearance issue, the case would have only cost me $0.0129 a day.  Yep, less than a penny.After a year, the integrity is sound.  I live in a region where the phone is exposed to 20*F temperatures, all the way up to 95*F temperatures.  No cracking, wear, or shrinking/expanding.Works well.
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: I bought this after I broke my phone.. it's definitely worth it to buy BEFORE you break it. On HTC Droid Incredible it fits well over phone's hard case; all ports, speakers & mic available with no issues. Definitely a cheap alternative to breaking or continuing the breaking if you're clumsy and drop your phone a lot, like I do. It's only one further layer to get to your SD card; because you have to take the Droid case apart anyway, so not a big loss. It's a little lose top to bottom and side to side in the middle; otherwise excellent buy for the price!!
title: HTC Incredible Black Silicone Skin Case

reviewText: the product was shipped exactly as advertised and it fit my phone perfectly, I am very happy with the product

title: HTC Standard Battery for HTC EVO 4G

reviewText: I ordered one of these batteries for my girlfriend's brand new HTC Evo 4G.  First off, the part number is not the same as the original OEM battery.  The OEM battery's part number is 35H00123-22M.  The one I received was 35H00123-25M.  The 1500mAh was consistent with the original according to the red sticker, so that was alright (contrary to some other batteries other customers received from various Amazon sellers when ordering this battery).The biggest problem I have is that it was listed as "NEW".  This battery is not NEW in any way.  The gold contacts on the battery are worn, so it's obvious this battery was heavily used at some point.  That is straight-up LYING to people and taking their money the whole time knowing they're scamming people.Last night she plugged in her phone before she went to bed using this battery, and this morning the battery didn't charge... at all.  She gave up on it, put the OEM battery back in her phone, and let me know what happened.I would have been irritated enough if it would have been for MY phone, but now it's 10X worse because it looks like I cheaped-out on it after I told her I was getting her a NEW second battery for it.In the end, Beast Deals lied in their description... twice.  Once about it being "new", and second about the item number itself.  Looks like it depends on which seller you buy from according to the comments, but Beast Deals lost all credibility as a reputable seller with me (and according to comments, others as well).I'll eat the $6 or whatever I paid for this POS, and use it as a cheap lesson learned.  I will be MUCH more cautious towards future purchases from 3rd party sellers on here.  I never had a problem with ANYTHING I purchased straight from Amazon.com as the fullfiller of my orders, or straight from a legit manufacturers (Dell, BlackBerry, etc) via Amazon.com.  It's because they are legitiment businesses that care about their reputation and satisfaction of their customers.  Beast Deals is a joke, period.
title: HTC Standard Battery for HTC EVO 4G

reviewText: These aren't OEM (meaning Original Equipment Manufacturer - in this case, HTC) batteries, but they work just fine.  In the picture, you can see the silver foil that supposed to be on the back of the batteries (HTC batteries have this)... the ones you'll receive don't.  Other than that, the replication is pretty impressive - I'd never know the difference if I hadn't looked at them side-by-side.Enough about them not being OEM, though.  And they could be feces-brown for all I care, as long as they work.They charge appropriately (people, let them charge COMPLETELY the first time you install them), and last at least as long as OEM.  (I have the data to prove this, by the way - I use Tasker to log battery stats every half hour, and I can show you that there is no statistically significant difference in battery drain per hour between these and OEM.)For the price, you won't be disappointed.  Get these and the Amzer external battery charger and you'll be set with a spare if you ever need it.
title: HTC Standard Battery for HTC EVO 4G

reviewText: The batteries appear to be the same as the original equipment.I keep my phone charging most of the time but I did charge themwith the wall charger(s) I purchased and tried them. The timebefore needing re-charging was the same as the factory version.

reviewText: I've used these for a couple of weeks now and can recommend them as a great "standard" headset that you'd use for everyday use.They're durable and the range is better than the stock set that typically come with mp3 players and smartphones.  I have a few that I use for different purposes and typically I use the cheap set for everyday use (under $20) and these are amongst the best that I've owned at this pricepoint.The lows are pretty decent and the highs have a nice response without too much distortion.  Also, the mic reproduces your voice very loudly.  No one knew that I was not holding the phone to my face.The only downside is that after about an hour, you'll start to notice the earpiece in your ear.  My ears were throbbing from the pain.  So, if you have small ears, then this headset will only serve you for brief periods of time before you'll have to take them out.However, for $4, including shipping, this is a steal.  Buying a couple for later use is a smart move.4 stars.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

I can listen through them, but the mic is a waste, and does not work at all. Neither will it work with my laptop, which most other headsets like this will.

reviewText: 4 stars because they are well built headphones. Alas, they do not work for iPhone 4, meaning the inline buttons do nothing when pressed.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Bought these as a gift for my Daughter & she loves them. They work very well with her phone. FAST delivery, packaged very safe, & good quality for the great price!  :)
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I purchased an HTC EVO a couple years back. During those two years, I lost my headphones several times. At less than $5 and free shipping, these are an exceptional value. The sound is good and the remote/mic work well. As an added bonus, I don't have to stress over losing my headphones as much, since these are offered at such a low price. I don't use the earpads that are included because they make the headphones too big, but without the earpads the headphones are a really good fit.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: to BIG for my or my brothers ears i just gave these away i hate them they feel CHEEP AF' not worth the wait !!DO NOT recomment to anyone
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I buy a lot from amazon, but this is the worst product I have ever received. You get what u pay for, these went directly to trash. I bought a quality pair as soon as those arrived. Disgusted, didn't fit, didnt work. Worse buy EVER, but i did Buy a pair of scosche earphones that are fabulous. Live and learn, cheap lesson.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: This worked pretty well until well got pulled accidentally and now it's half broken, you can still hear things but barely.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: The headphones are good for how much it costs, but the microphone broke on me after a few months. The wires are also very long, maybe even too long.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: This product looks, works, and appear to an authentic HTC headset.  I was skeptical, but for the price, I gave it a shot.  When I got it, I compared it with my myTouch4G headset, and they were similar in quality.  The design is different, but you can tell the same company made both.  Even the lengths were exactly the same.Good:- Works as designed- Mute and volume +/- buttons inline with wire- call quality is loud and hasn't got complaint from anyone- Authentic HTC with HTC logo on productBad (all minor):- earpiece is a bit big for my ear- cord overall length is a bit long for my taste.  I'm 5/7 and it hangs a bit.- cord is on the stiff side, so it still has the bends in it from being originally packaged in a wounded position.  They really ought to consider this aspect of the design.  Apple is the only ones who gets it with a nice soft cord.- when used with my BlackBerry Torch, I can hear feedback from my arms rubbing against the cord - it's very sensitive.  Not a big deal.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Regardless of the photo, the headphones did not contain the foam covers for the ear pieces. The headset works fine otherwise, but if you specifically don't like the plastic ear pieces in your ears without foam, don't buy these.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I am glad I did not spend too much on these... I will make this short and sweet...These earbuds are huge!!! If you are used to custom sized earbuds that actually fit into your ears than these are not for you.Its like shoving a penny into your ear they simply do not fit and hurt as well.. I am going to try to re-gift them otherwise they are going in to the garbage.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: After reading many of the reviews for this product, I reluctantly purchased a pair. But for $4 I thought it worth the risk. They arrived very quickly and I must say that I am totally pleased. There is no indication that this is anything other than a quality HTC product. All controls function as they should, calls are clear for both parties, and sound quality is of the best I've heard from ear buds. I have already placed an order for 4 more pair. 3 for friends and a spare set for me!
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I've been looking far & wide for a new set of earbuds with microphone support. I'm not an audiophile and I wouldn't dare spend over $10 for earbuds. I just want a pair that works, comes with a microphone, and has the added bonus of answering/making calls & skipping through my MP3s.This pair, for $4.25 cannot be beat. It's even compatible with the EVO 3D despite the name saying EVO 4G.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I ordered these because I lost my palm pre headset, which I loved.  They were less expensive, by a dollar, and since they were HTC...and I have an EVO...so I thought, "Why not?...." This was a mistake. The sound is terrible, they're not loud at all, and can't even the smallest amount of bass. Regarding phone calls, I was told sound muffled and like I was in a tunnel.I'm going to order another palm pre stereo headset right now....
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Not recommended.  Falls out of my ears easily.  Lousy sound quality.  Friends say there is lots of background noise, hard to hear me when I talk on them.  Cheaply constructed and designed with no thought to ergonomics.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I got decent sound but the microphone/volume features did not work.Not a total loss as I really bought these for my iPad.Worth the few dollars I paid for sure.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: HTC OEM - if not, it is an extremely good copy!  Works well as an exact replacement for the original HTC Aria headset.  Same length, look and feel as the original.  All controls function correctly and audio is clear.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: These are nice and sound decent but, though not as durable and feel like better quality product, Blackberry OEM earbuds have better mic and sound much better. (Yes I bought 2 sets, one from each sellers.)
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: these a original htc stereo headset for the htc evo 4g it is black. it is awesome i love it
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: The headset works.  You can make a call and you can listen to music.Problem?  I can only hear out of 1 of the 2 earbuds.  Kind of defeats the purpose of a stereo earbud.  If it were not broken, I might like it more.  3 stars because it works.  2 stars off because it only works in 1 ear.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I got these headphones when I picked up a windows phone.  I don't use the windows phone but really like the headphones the clip keeps the mic in place and people never even know I am using earphones and a mic when I talk to them.  I have purchased 5 of these as I do break them!
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I got these to use on my Nokia Lumia 920 running Windows Phone 8. Every aspect of these headphones works perfectly. The sound, the microphone. The remote will also pause or restart music. You can skip forward (double click) or backward (triple click). And the real bonus is that it will even control the volume on your phone! Yay! I don't mean a cheap little stick on the headset that you can use to adjust the headsets volume, I mean the buttons on the headset will change the actual volume level being outputted by the phone. Very nice!So why just three starts? Well, like everyone else says, the darn buds are just a little too big. It makes these very uncomfortable to wear and if I do any sudden movements, they ease out of position -- the don't completely fall, they just slip out of place so I have to keep adjusting them. I'm tall (6'2") and I do not have small ears.Unless you have very large ears, I'd stay away from these. Too bad, as they are great in so many other ways.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Very reasonably priced with quality, Won't say they are best but does the job.1. Good headphones for talking, it got a nice clip and good quality wiring, doesn't look cheap at all.2. I like the buttons for pausing music and calls, i hear to lot of internet radio (tunewiki) and i can only pause and can't resume.3. If you are looking for good quality music output then these are not recommended, music quality is pretty normal.Overall satisfied customer :)
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: These headphones were horrible. They broke after two weeks. I was so disappointed because I really like them because they were black. The white one get dirty so fast.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: i luv these cause they sound so loud and are great. I use them on my tablet and its unbelieveable. My husband only asks for HTC headsets because he has a lil trouble hearing from 1 ear but with these set he can hear his music or watch his shows perfect. MUST HAVE. Mind u I have a samsung G2 and there sets sux. sorry.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I use it only as a hands free while driving, and it works great.  I can answer the call just by pressing a button on the headset.  It is comfortable too.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I am a bit of an audiophile myself and I have more expensive phones than these, though these earbuds works well as affordable replaceable units. If you prefer cleaner sound these  actually provide good clarity for what they're worth. For more bassy sound try the Palm Pre headset. But so far I prefer the sound of these since they have cleaner midrange for voices. They're bit bulkier due to long cable length.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: So i was looking for a replacement headset for my iPhone and this was $7 and added to my super saver shipping... why not spend some to save some!It worked on the iPhone. Even the center button. Prev/Next (Vol+,Vol-) doesnt work however but that is minor.Sound Quality is ok. The iPhone stock headphones sound way better but these are not as bad as I sound.They are original to! Not cheap knockoffs
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I love the controls close to me specially when I'm driving. Voice command is better on this set than other ones I've tried. Not the best quality of sound but for the price, you can't expect much. It's still good nontheless. great looking black color too.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: These are somewhat uncomfortable to me, although that's true of all earbud-style earphones. The bigger problem to me is that it seems like the mic is waaaay to far down. I have to do inventive things with the excess cord to get the mic positioned well to have a conversation. Aside from that, the sound is good both ways, and the build quality is very good.  They're a really good headset to start with, but you can probably do better without spending too much more.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: One earpiece wasn't even attached.  You can tell from the cheapness  of the product (and packaging) that this  wasn't just a bad  pair. These are obviously cheap knockoffs. They are so crappy that the 5 bucks I paid was way too much. These are  worse  quality than what you'd get at the dollar store.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: It's extremely hard to find wired earbuds with more than one button that works on Android and Windows phones. It seems everything is designed to work on iThings. These don't have very good sound quality, but I only wanted them for when I go on a run, and they're acceptable for that purpose.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Nice piece, works well for calls and sound quality is "sufficient" as a few people have already said.  I'm using mine with a HTC EVO.  However, mine does not work with the HTC music app.  I downloaded the Double Twist player app based on what someone said in their review and it works great to control that app.  Double Twist even has an option to let the headset control your music without even opening the app...even when the screen is locked.  Very cool.I'm more stoked on the app than the headset, but since I bought the headphones to control my music, I'm just glad that there's at least one music app it works with.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: My original headphones that came with my phone started fraying.  They still worked but one ear was messing up.  I bought this pair and they work pretty well.  The cushion pieces are a little on the cheap side, but you get what you pay for.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Its a nice headphones but it took a little longer than i thought to get to me. other than it coming a day or two late im satisfied.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I've been looking all over for a decent headset with controls that actually work for my HTC Evo. Most other headsets the play/call button is the only thing that works. With this headset all the buttons work perfectly. It is definitely what I have been looking for. As for the quality of the headset, the cord is pretty think and doesn't seem like it would get cut easily or break. The sound is also very surprising for the price and is enough for me. The call quality and microphone are also good quality. If you own a Evo 4g and are looking for a decent casual headset with music controls this is what you have been looking for.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: This is same like original headphones, probably it is real OEM. Works just fine, good sound quality & the music control buttons work too. Great purchase fro a great price!!
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Great product. And over the top customer service.  The product arrived on time even though I moved to a different location. I would continue to but from this group of people on any product that I would need for my phone.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: the earbuds are a little too big but you will get use to them in no time, the earphones are pretty good, good sound quality, the call quality is good, all the keys work, the only problem i had was that.. werent they suppose to say htc on them? and i didnt get those earbud pads with them either.***** UPDATE ******so mine stopped working after a couple of months and then i ordered these again and this time they are exactly how they were described and im very pleased with the product.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: For the price, these headphones are perfect for htc evo phone. I listen to music on it and the volume is great. Also, I can talk to people on it and the sound through there is great as well. Definitely recommend this
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Performs just as expected, at less than 1/3 of the price of the same item from HTC's web site.  What's not to like?
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: These headphones look pretty but you need to have giant earlobes to fit them in properly - however the control button is neat it allows you to control the music vs calling back people it was really great - that would be the only good thing - if you have big ear holes then these are perfect for you
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Very clear & durable.  Im pretty rough on headsets & these have stood the test of time...and me.  The music control buttons may not work for all phones
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I've purchased this same product a few times over the past several months.  It works well, at least, initially. The sound quality in the earbuds is good and the microphone is pretty good as well.  However, the product seems to last a few months and then goes bad, either the microphone stops working suddenly, or there is no longer audio coming out of the earbuds.  More often then not, the microphone stops working.  I take care of my belongings, this being no exception.  I don't know if this is a manufacturing defect, but since the item price is generally not expensive, it isn't too much of a problem to replace them every once in a while.  The worst part is when you don't have a backup hands free kit, and have to wait a few days for a replacement to arrive.  I am now keeping a backup set while I experiment with other models/brands in hopes of finding one that delivers equal quality audio but is more reliable.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: I just got mine and I'm using them right now.  I was afraid it was going to be a generic brand because the price was so cheap.  They are are actual HTC headphones and the quality is great.  Just as nice as when they come with the phone, if not, a little nicer.  The sound quality is premium.  They look just like the ones in the photos.  At this price, it was practically a steal.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Bought this form my HTC EVO 4G and it works great. Better than spending 30$ for an Apple earphone. Voice qualityy is crisp and the earphones fit well.Cant expect more for 6$, and the shipping was super fast too.
title: HTC Stereo Headset for HTC EVO 4G (Black)

reviewText: Excellent since you can charge your cellphone and kindle (or other devices) at the same time.  Portable, versatile, and effective.  (I replaced my girlfriends car charger with this so we could both charge simultaneously.)

reviewText: Cable developed a short in it after about a year of non-strenuous use.  Disappointed.  At the current pricing I'd say it's overpriced now.  Glad I bought it when it was cheaper.  Other than that, seems OK, nothing special.

reviewText: I needed a car charger for my new phone, but not an expensive one from the manufacturer. This item works great, and lets me charge my bluetooth headset and phone in my car at the same time. I am not used to having a car charger, but my new smart phone battery can wear down quickly, especially when using 4G, GPS, and a maps/navigation app.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Despite how the item is described it is not OEM. And it is cheap. It broke with less than 5 times being used. Horrible product. Bad seller for carrying product like this.

reviewText: All the features of the single charger from original manufacturer. All works well, I use with the HTC One and it works perfectly.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: works good as intended. arrived on time, good quality
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Great double charger.  Can charge up two phones at the same time, one phone and the GPS.  Love it for the long haul.  Great buy!
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: two USB ports in one car charger is great! they both worked simultaneously for me, only down side is the unit only comes with one cable... so you have to use the one that came with your phone (that detaches from the wall charging unit). that is my only complaint! (using for an HTC EVO and HTC EVO Shift)
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: At least so far it works.  Dual port car charger.  Anything you can charge via USB (some cell phones, iPods, etc) you appear to be able to charge with this.  And it has capacity for two such devices to be connected.  A bit pricier than some others here on Amazon, but seems to be well-made.  No fear of it falling apart as others have described with the cheaper models.So far so good.  I expect this to get a lot of use, especially when we travel.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: I ordered this when it was $8.95, so for a dual usb charger, even though I saw the bad cable reviews, I figured it was a deal. I really have not tested charging two phones (only a phone and a bluetooth headset,) but it works well. The cable died within a month.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Has worked with all my Androids from different brands HTC, Motorola, Samsung, LG for more than two years.  Overly impress although Idid need to change the cable a couple of times which was a cheap fix.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: This charger is awesome! When my husband and I had the same phones we hooked this up in his car and would charge both of just whomever's phone and it worked great! No need to fight over someone hogging the outlet to charge their phone.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: This product has been with me for a while. Many after-market chargers have the stem which is too short to reach the positive lead, but this one works fine. I keep it as a spare now, but highly recommend it.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: charger works fine, not much else to say, adapter works fine so far. material not exactly what I expected, but for what i paid it works fine
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Charger works great with my HTC EVO3D. One downside to this is the cord provided will only charge, no data. The cord shipped with mine only lasted a few months before it quit charging my phone. Other then that its a good product.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: It worked great for the HTC I am still using it for a different phone at this point. In fact I have been able to use the USB plugs to charge many items. I highly recommend this!! Can be used for other phones that use the same plug. Bought this back in 2010 and have never had an issue with it.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Was very dissapointed. I specifically researched and tried to MAKE SURE I was ordering an official, original HTC charger knowing the knock-offs are crap that don't work long if at all. I received my order very quickly and the packing was great. The product packaging said htc on it but the charger itself does NOT have the htc logo and the cord is flat not round like the one that came with my phone. I requested and received an immediate refund from Amazon, which was a super easy and fast transaction, thank you Amazon! No one wants to have to return something but it's nice to know it is fast and easy when you need to. I immediately orderedKensington K33497US PowerBolt Duo Car Charger, iPhone 4 and iPhone 4S CompatibleI chose it for the charger portion which is what I really wanted to begin with, the reviews are great on the new one coming and since I can't be guaranteed to receive an OEM htc I will go with a respected name brand like Kensington. In summary I would say just beware with this one you cannot be sure you will get an actual OEM htc charger since this is fulfilled by sellers.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: I ordered this item for my car and my husband borrowed it for a business trip only to leave it in the rental car.  I would order a spare because these work so great!
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Probably one of the best I have ever bought. Works great, second usb port comes in handy a lot. Price is great as well.
title: MicroUSB Car Charger for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Well, this cable worked out great for the HTC Evo.  It does everything it's suppose to do.  The cable is your standard 3' length.  You can use it in conjunction with a HTC USB AC plug or you can plug it directly into your computer and have your phone charged that way.Overall it is a high quality cable.  It even comes with a small white sticker on it stating it was an HTC cable.  Please note that you may be able to find a similar cable cheaper elsewhere but for the comfort of having a HTC cable, it was worth the additional dollar.

title: HTC micro USB Sync and Charge Data Cable for HTC HD2 HTC EVO 4G HTC Legend HTC HD mini HTC Droid Incredible HTC Nexus One

reviewText: I didn't realize that the Droid was actually a computer that I could talk on until I did my research after purchasing the phone.  This also meant that it would not hold its charge as long as my previous phones.  So I needed to purchase an extra charger.This one fit the bill perfectly. title: HTC micro USB Sync and Charge Data Cable for HTC HD2 HTC EVO 4G HTC Legend HTC HD mini HTC Droid Incredible HTC Nexus One

The seller should not put up a picture of something and sell us something else.  I'm pissed off.
title: HTC micro USB Sync and Charge Data Cable for HTC HD2 HTC EVO 4G HTC Legend HTC HD mini HTC Droid Incredible HTC Nexus One

title: HTC micro USB Sync and Charge Data Cable for HTC HD2 HTC EVO 4G HTC Legend HTC HD mini HTC Droid Incredible HTC Nexus One

reviewText: Dead On Arrival.  Plugged it into the phone to charge it up: blinking amber light = battery is no good.  Looked promising, too, as the battery looked just like the original one the phone came with and appeared to look brand-new to me.  Wrong.  Well, now you know why this item is so CHEAP.
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: I was never able to get this battery to work.  What a rip off.  I get the amber light showing when I first plug it in and then the screen of the phone flashes quick white lights several times before it completely shuts down.  Very disappointed in this purchase.  : (
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: I didn't expect much for the price I paid but this battery worked just like the original in my friend's phone (I bought it as a gift)It fit perfectly and lasted as long as the original.
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: I needed a replacement battery for my wife's phone after the first one crapped out.  This one was as advertised, a replacement battery and it kept working another 2 years after it until the phone finally gave out.
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: While the battery is an OEM battery in good condition, the contacts show signs of wear from insertion/removal from a previous phone.  The vendor did contact me to resend another battery stating new, but it showed signs of wear as well.  The battery's do work, they do hold a charge, however I still question the "new"ness of them.  Great price though for an OEM battery.  I would likely order from them again even knowing what I know due to the price point.
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: I really needed an extra battery because I use my phone for work a great deal of the time.  This was purchased with the Docking Station Charger and it has worked out very well for me.
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: I give one star for both batteries I purchased because they hold a charge. However the contacts on both batteries looked used! UPON FURTHER INSPECTION I REALIZED NEITHER BATTERIES WERE EVEN MADE BY HTC!!! Each battery was made by a different company, and one has a dent in it. In the description the seller says "This battery is an original accessory manufactured by HTC." But this is a lie.One star because they do function, but I'm pissed off because I could have got cheap import knock-off batteries with dents for cheaper on Ebay. The part numbers in the description don't even match!
title: HTC OEM BTR-6200B BATTERY Droid Eris 6200 Incredible

reviewText: Replacement battery brought my cell phone back to like new as far as the power is concerned. I'm sorry most newer phones make it harder to replace the battery
title: OEM HTC BTR6300B Standard Battery for MyTouch 3G Slide, Red

reviewText: After watching the battery life of my HTC Droid Incredible diminish so that I couldn't even make it through the day without recharging, I found this OEM battery online for only six bucks.  It arrived in a padded envelope without any other packaging, but it was in perfect shape, ...and it works great!  It is *exactly* like the battery that came with the phone. Full battery life of my phone is now restored.  I can go through the whole day with about 60% battery left by the time I go to bed.
title: OEM HTC BTR6300B Standard Battery for MyTouch 3G Slide, Red

reviewText: Pluses and minuses (In order of importance)+ Works with my battery-draining HTC Thunderbolt- Doesn't come with cord, so you either use an extra cord that you have lying around, swap out one cord with multiple outlets, or you need to buy an extra cord that is sold separately.+ Came exactly as advertised- For "Free shipping" Amazon Prime gurus: If you choose to buy an extra cord separately, there weren't any amazon prime vendors that have the cord available for free 2 day shipping when I ordered mine... Minor pain, but the split shipping was worth the cheaper overall cost.

reviewText: This is a nice and compact USB charger that outputs 1000 mA current good for most devices except iPad/iPad2/Amazon Kindle Fire.Its thin form factor means it won't block any adjacent power outlets when it is plugged into the wall or an extension power strip.Since the price difference between one with a micro USB cable and without is only 61 cents, I would suggest getting one with the cable.If you need an extra iPad charger (2100 mA output current), I would recommend AmazonBasicsAmazonBasics Wall Charger with USB Outlet( 2.1 Amp Output).
title: Travel Charger U250 for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: My family have 3 HTC Phones and I needed extras for traveling. I use one for work and use one for home. I needed few more when traveling and this was a bargain than having to pay for the Original OEM product. I am not sure if this is OEM but works great. for the price i have no complaint.  Charges my HTC phones and also my Google Nexus and Kindle fire Hd.  of course it takes a lot longer to charge the Tablet than the phones.. but charges them also  (Tablets take more time to charge using phone chargers .. its a given unless you buy the  the chargers meant for those tablets ie. more amps then charging time is drastically reduced)
title: Travel Charger U250 for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: .Charges my iPhone 4S about 80% to 90 % as fast as Apple's wall charger (see Note 1). Faster than many 3rd party chargers. This wall charger does not claim to be for iPhone.PROs:* Excellent value when under 5 bucks* Does not block other outlets (see Note 2)* Full speed charging of many smartphones (1 amp max output)- Branded product - amazon reviews are for this exact product, not misdirectedOKs:- Fairly compact for travel- Small scratches on mine. But it looks like genuine HTC, high quality.- - - Pricing - - -3rd party merchants are often way cheaper than amazon. Check for multiple listings of this item, and select a highly rated merchant. Reviews suggest some merchants are selling bad product under this listing. I got two from 11th Street Wireless - no problems.- - - Notes - - -Note 1: iPhone charging speed: I tested using a 2-month old iPhone 4S while on/locked. These results do not apply to other phones.30-50%. . . 50-70%. . . 70-90%. . . Avg . . . Charger--------- . . . --------- . . . --------- . . . ------ . . . ---------18min . . . . 18min . . . . 23min . . . . 1.02 . . . Apple20min . . . . 22min . . . . 26min . . . . 0.88 . . . HTC U25035min . . . . 35min . . . . 39min . . . . 0.55 . . . Computer USB port (.5 amp)Avg is "percent per minute" overall -- from 30% charged to 90% charged.Note 2: Blocking other outlets. Seems like small thing, but it can be a hassle. Unplugging lamps, alarm clocks, etc to charge your phone? Just say no (or carry an extension cord).
title: Travel Charger U250 for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: Yeah, yeah, I know we're not supposed to review the seller with the product, but based on other reviews, I ordered this U250 from CCMAccessories. What arrived in OEM packaging (little nondescript corn starch bag) was a 79H00095 charger. Initial test with my HTC Amaze and HTC cable, this charger provided > 800mA of charge current, which other so-called 1000mA chargers do not. See my photo in the gallery to see what kind of smooth charge curve you should see.So for charging my HTC, this charger was what I needed, the correct HTC part that charges faster and more efficiently than third party brands that claim to be the same, but actually charge up my phone slower.
title: Travel Charger U250 for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: The classic sign of crappy power adapters is that your device screen locks up or nearly so. That's what my palm, my android, and my old motorola phone all did. If you put a scope on the power it's quite noisy - and thats what affects your device.For that reason I long ago stopped buying OEM clone stuff as while hit or miss the misses were just a PITA and it's had to tell.So I only buy genuine brand - usually Motorola or in this case HTC.This one looks great - but behaved poorly and locked up my HTC Android device when plugged in. Comparing it closely, the printing on the back is similar - but different. More Chinese characters - and some word issues - like "Emerson" printed as "Emer son". Another sign was the packaging - just in foam wrap - not even in a sealed bulk OEM pack.It may well be that this seller is getting a mixed bag of good genuine and crappy (but good looking) clones. But I've lost faith in them. Hopefully I can find somebody that has genuine stuff at a decent price that's all confirmable.
title: Travel Charger U250 for HTC Thunderbolt - Black

reviewText: I purchased two OEM HTC USB Travel Charger Adapter U250 from two different vendors here. One from "RKA Wireless", and one from "Cell Factory Outlet".  Both are counterfeit knockoffs of the true OEM HTC charger.  Their housing and external markings are very well done -- they deceptively mimic the HTC logo and forge the certification agency marks.  I measured the output of the charger and compared its actual capability against its stated specification and the capability of a genuine HTC charger.  The genuine item provides a reasonably well regulated 5 volts.  It provides 5.06V open circuit, dropping to 4.8 V at 0.6A, and dropping further to 4.53V at 1.13A.  The counterfeits provide a poorly regulated 5.37 V open circuit, decreasing steadily with current to 4.5V at 450 mA.  Attempts to draw more current just result in rapid voltage drop, at 500 mA the voltage is down to 2V.  That's quite a deviation from the 5V 1A marked on the back of the enclosure.  The too great voltage when unloaded is a hazard, and the drop in voltage at moderate current draw will cause unpredictable results when charging most devices.Interestingly, these counterfeits appear to have similar voltage/current capability (hence probably similar internal circuitry) of some other counterfeit chargers sold through Amazon, like the White USB Cable Power Adapter (Wall Charger Adaptor with fixed blades) for Apple iPod, iPhone, iPhone 3G, iPhone 4,Touch, Shuffle, Nano, Classic which I purchased through Amazon from "A Sonic (Your USA Store)".Since writing this review I've stumbled across a comprehensive test and comparison of true chargers vs counterfeit chargers, which you may find helpful: [...]

reviewText: I purchased two OEM HTC USB Travel Charger Adapter U250 from two different vendors here. One from this listing, provided by "RK Wireless" (called RKA Wireless on their packing slip), and one from "Cell Factory Outlet" (from this page:OEM HTC USB Travel Charger Adapter U250 / CNR6300 / 79H00095-14M). Both are counterfeit knockoffs of the true OEM HTC charger. Their housing and external markings are very well done -- they deceptively mimic the HTC logo and forge the certification agency marks. I measured the output of the charger and compared its actual capability against its stated specification and the capability of a genuine HTC charger. The genuine item provides a reasonably well regulated 5 volts.  It provides 5.06V open circuit, dropping to 4.8 V at 0.6A, and dropping further to 4.53V at 1.13A. The counterfeits provide a poorly regulated 5.37 V open circuit, decreasing steadily with current to 4.5V at 450 mA. Attempts to draw more current result in rapid voltage drop, at 500 mA the voltage is down to 2V. That's quite a deviation from the 5V 1A marked on the back of the enclosure. The too great voltage when unloaded is a hazard to some devices, and the drop in voltage at moderate current draw will cause unpredictable results when charging most cell phones.  These chargers do not charge my HTC phone properly.Interestingly, these counterfeits appear to have similar voltage/current capability (hence probably similar internal circuitry) of some other counterfeit chargers sold through Amazon, like the White USB Cable Power Adapter (Wall Charger Adaptor with fixed blades) for Apple iPod, iPhone, iPhone 3G, iPhone 4,Touch, Shuffle, Nano, Classic which I purchased through Amazon from "A Sonic (Your USA Store)".Since writing this review I've stumbled across a comprehensive test and comparison of true chargers vs counterfeit chargers, which you may find helpful: [...]

reviewText: I had the HTC Incredible for one year, which was several months too long.  Call quality was fair and UI was fair.  The main weakness with Android is that when Google releases a new OS version, it has to go to the vendor so they can tweak and then release it themselves.  This can take FOREVER.  The update to Froyo came fairly quickly, but soon there was talk of Gingerbread, Honeycomb, and even Ice Cream.  Well, HTC FINALLY released Gingerbread, and that was it.  Along the way, I encountered several software bugs, primarily with exchange mail.  I wrote HTC several times and they always came back with these outlandish "troubleshooting" processes.  The other thing was that HTC advertised that you could "make it yours"...FAR from it, guys !!  Just ONE example that aggravated the crap out me was not being able to turn off haptic feedback with the dialer.  HTC said that was designed like that in case it was in your pocket and you could tell if it was dialing accidentally.  SERIOUSLY, even if I did keep it in my pocket, it would be LOCKED !!  Got the iphone 4s, SOOO much happier !!
title: HTC DROID INCREDIBLE Android Phone Black (Verizon Wireless)

reviewText: Hi. I've had my HTC Incredible for just over a year now.  When it worked, it was pretty cool.  The battery lasted a couple days, the functionality and apps you could download worked pretty well.  But inside of the 1 year mark of owning it, it all went south.First, the battery died.  Over time, it would last less and less until finally it just up and died and wouldn't take a charge. Fine - I bought an extended battery that worked well.Then, the charging jack broke.  That's the little port on the left side of the phone.  Won't take a charge, won't work for copying photos/music to and from the phone. So, along with buying a battery, I bought some (cheap) external battery chargers and some more batteries.  It works OK.  Still can't get more than 24 hours of use from a battery (god forbid you actually USE apps on this thing - they KILL the battery).Next, the power button died.  I can't turn it on and off.  I have to click it a million times to hopefully make it activate the screen.  I certainly can't put it to sleep anymore, and I've accidentally called people because of this.-In summary, it's just not well-designed.  I didn't even mention that I had to re-boot the phone because I could no longer get the "marketplace" app to work.  That was a HUGE pain in the butt.-When the iphone 5 comes out, I'm switching.  I'm done with these shoddy impersonations of what is simply the greatest phone out there: the iphone.
title: HTC DROID INCREDIBLE Android Phone Black (Verizon Wireless)

reviewText: This phone is very responsive and has a crisp and clear screen.  The proximity and light sensors actually work and work well on this phone.  I have not had a dropped call.  Speakers are loud and the kickstand is very useful.  I switched from an Iphone 4 for this and can say I will never go back to an Apple Phone.  The phone is upgradable to 7.5 (mango) and will update when connected to zune software.  The music and photo programs as well as the live tiles are vey well designed and easier to use.  And yes it is UNLOCKED and I am using this phone right now in Germany (on a German network).  (American Citizen).The only issues I have see is that the phone was packaged "new" but I can tell it was probably refurbished due to some light and VERY minor scratches on the back cover and the APP store/marketplace does not have the same support (as many apps) as Anroid or Iphone, but you can still find what you need.  Battery life is not too terrible, lasts me all day with intermittent usage (heavy at times).Apps that look ugly on Iphone and Android are crisp and clean on WP7.In closing, I recommend this phone and platform over the competition. And the phone comes with Microsoft Office.
title: HTC T8788 7 Surround Unlocked Phone with Windows 7, Surround Sound, 5MP Camera and HD Video - US Warranty - Black

reviewText: The HTC Surround was one of the original Windows Phone 7 devices announced in late 2010. I bought one in 2012 to replace a broken Samsung Focus. The Focus lasted 18 months of torture, and the Surround barley made it 4 months.The Surround has two pop-up speakers and a kick stand to watch Netflix, YouTube and listen to music. The problem is that this adds a LOT of bulk to the device. The sliding mechanism is more fragile than a phone without moving parts and this phone does not even benefit from having a real keyboard. Worse still is that you have to slide the speakers out when playing anything or the sound will come out muffled.Now I didn't really mind the sliding speakers as I used the phone for Netflix a lot. The pop-up speakers and kickstand worked fine for watching movies on the go. But the experience was still bad because of the screen. For whatever reason, HTC decided to use some very old tech on the screen. Blacks are washed out and gray. Colors don't pop. The screen was fairly small at 3.7" and motion wasn't as smooth as on the Samsung Focus. All in all, it's a pretty terrible viewing experience. This is completely inexcusable for any device running Windows Phone that relies so heavily on deep blacks and saturated colors.So how about durability? Yeah, not so much. As I said, this phone lasted 4 months compared to my Previous Samsung Focus under the same conditions (lasting 18 months). When dropped, the screen shattered. This was no Gorilla Glass, and it showed.So how about performance? The Surround uses the same Snapdragon processor of other first generation Windows Phones and many Android phones of that time (late 2010). The Surround uses a slower 16GB Sandisk SD hard for its internal memory (it is not swappable, and cannot be removed). The result is that the phone takes a lot longer loading apps then other phones using NAND memory such as the Focus.If you are looking for a cheap replacement smartphone running WP7, the Samsung Focus is a better alternative. If you want something running WP8, try the Nokia 520. This phone simply has no real advantage over anything else on the market today, even for bargain hunters.
title: HTC T8788 7 Surround Unlocked Phone with Windows 7, Surround Sound, 5MP Camera and HD Video - US Warranty - Black

reviewText: My 5 stars are for the HTC 7 Surround phone itself; I'll explain.  My cousin has this phone, she bought it about a year ago and she loves it. I played with it from time to time and found it easy to use and very stable (unlike my Android phone), and the slideup speakers to be cool. It eventually inspired me to buy an HTC Radar 4G and switch to T-Mobile as my carrier. I love WinPhone 7.5, so much so that I wanted to become a developer.Which led me to purchase this "unlocked" phone, to use as a development phone. I purchased it from OEM Planet (aka Young Kimbrogh) fulfilled by Amazon.com.  Unfortunately the phone never worked.  It would turn on, show the HTC logo, and then just vibrate and reboot itself.  I even purchased a genuine AT&T; SIM card and activated the SIM card (against my wishes... as I'd had some real bad experience with AT&T; before!) but it didn't make no difference, the phone simply refused to go beyond the logo screen!Guys... If anyone has bought an unlocked Surround that works, please let me know where you bought it from! Thanks.

reviewText: Before addressing the hardware and functionality of this phone, let's address quickly the five-part equation that makes up your overall smart phone user experience:(1) the hardware...the phone itself(2) operating system software(3) installed applications(4) the network (overall, and where you happen to be using the phone at a particular time)(5) the service providerIn some cases, there are serial dependencies on the factors above, as many phones are tied to specific operating systems or service providers. Or perhaps you spend a lot of time in an area without 4G service. Just remember that even if you make a great phone choice, deficiencies in the other areas can diminish your overall user experience.Don't move to a smart phone without some research into these choices. Which provider? Which mobile operating system? Who can offer me the best service, or the best combination of value and service? The rest of this review assumes you've already figured out why a phone with the Android operating system might be a better choice for you than an iPhone, a Blackberry or a Windows-based smart phone solution...Bottom line for the HTC EVO 4G: feature loaded, user-friendly and a hard choice to go wrong with in a crowded smart phone market.The phone ships with an impressive array of capability and apps, and finding and installing new ones from the Android marketplace is easy even for non-techies.Two very strong performers in the pre-installed applications are Google-powered Voice Search and Navigate: both are eerily good at delivering search results and driving/walking directions. This phone's voice-to-text interface is also very good, and can be used for both composing text messages and delivering search results without typing. Surprisingly, a voice-based dialing app that is part of the operating system's collection of widgets seldom gets one right. The Evo's on-screen keyboard is adaptive to your compositions over time, and will suggest auto-completes for words you frequently type.The phone includes two cameras: an outward facing high resolution (8 megapixel) still/video camera, and a front facing 1.3 megapixel camera for video applications. It ships with an 8 GB microSD card. One surprising oversight of this phone is the placement of the microSD card inside the battery compartment. Although you can move files to an from it via the USB port, this phone would be improved if the card were accessible without removing the back cover.In addition to the USB port, the phone has a 3.5mm aux audio jack and an HDMI port.The rear of the phone includes a "kickstand", allowing you to stand the phone on a horizontal surface when viewing the display in landscape mode (great for using the speakerphone or watching videos).Customization of the scrolling display screens is intuitive. In our house, even less technically savvy users were re-arranging icons and applications in no time.Each of phone, video and still image quality are satisfactory.The overall finish of this phone is --literally-- quite slick. It can go sliding easily on leather car seat, and both the screen and frame will attract and display fingerprints. Whether or not you opted in to the damage/loss insurance that most providers offer, I'd strongly recommend both a screen protector and some case or holster to offer a modicum of protection to the phone.Mnay options exist for protection, but for our multiple Evo phones we've found the following to provide a good mix of protection and price:--"Fishbone" protective case (red linked here; other colors are available)--SGP STEINHEIL Anti FingerprintSprint Screen Protector (Anti Fingerprint)Let these protective devices soak up the wear and tear instead of your phone and display.Other reviews have discussed battery life, and it's worth addressing. This phone has five separate radio transmit/receive devices:-the standard cellular (3G/CDMA) transceiver-the 4G transceiver-Bluetooth (for short-range use of hands-free devices and data exchange)-GPS receiver-Wifi transceiverEach of these devices will exert its own demand on the battery. Selectively turning them off when not needed, along with setting a shorter time to turn off the display (2 minutes or 1 minute) will go a long way to mitigate the battery issue. Additionally, there are extended life aftermarket batteries (usually with an accompanying modified case cover to accommodate their their additional bulk) that will easily get you through your work day away from external power.A note about apps:Android is a Google operating system, and access to the Android marketplace for additional apps requires entry through a Google/Gmail account (either existing or one you create when setting up the phone). In return for the apps, be aware that you surrender significant personal information on your phone, your location (at minumum the nearest cell tower, and in some cases your GPS-derived location) and details of how you used the phone and applications. Providing this information is the cost of admission for functionality of the apps. I'm not offering a value judgement on this...just pointing it out for your information.Finally, a note about pricing:Comparison shop and pay attention when you're ready to make the move to a smart phone. For the hardware purchase, you can expect to find considerable differences in the prices (even when upgrade discount and rebates are included) from different vendors. Be sure to check out each each of your provider's "store" (brick and mortar, by phone and online), big box stores and even Amazon's new wireless store. It's worth investing a couple minutes in this research to save a considerable amount on the purchase price.Becoming a smart phone user begins with shopping smartly! )-

reviewText: Ok...coming from a Blackberry, this phone is amazing by comparison.1) It's faster2) Comes with more apps3) More easy to use home screen4) Has a better camera5) 4G6) Connects to my Outlook Express email without the $20/month blackberry Enterprise serviceIt's a great piece of hardware.However, since my wife and I were mid-contract, I didn't feel like shucking out $800 for 2 new ones without contract, so I opted for the refurbished ones.  Both have had their quirks.Mine: Randomly will reload the home screen when I exit an application.  A minor, yet annoying little bug.  I'm not sure if it has something to do with the "live" desktop that I use. Otherwise, it's a great phone.Hers: Randomly has SERIOUS camera problems.  Will either go to a black screen or a screen that is rainbow colored when the camera is selected.  Removing the battery and reinserting it usually will fix it, but it's maddening when you have to pry off the Trident Case that I bought for her to protect the thing.Overall, I really like the phone..just have some issues

reviewText: I got this phone after having an LG Optimus for one year. I was pleased with the performance of the LG and thought that it was great for my needs. However, I had a friend playing with his EVO and asked to play a little. The processor on the EVO is insane, the screen and display look amazing and the feel of the phone is great. The screen is an inch larger than the LG, but the phone itself is only 1/2 inch taller and less than 1/2 an inch wider than the LG, making it still easy to fit in a pocket. I have downloaded apps on both 3G and Wifi and can't believe how much faster it is than the LG. The battery life is pretty similar to the LG, it lasts from 0700 to about 1600, but I work in dungeon with no reception, so it's constantly draining looking for signal, common for any phone I have seen in this place. Extra batteries are cheap and easy to swap out.My wife just got an iphone 4s and I was thinking about one also, I'm glad I went with the EVO, bigger screen, SD card, seems more user friendly and I don't have to worry about Siri telling me that she can't answer my question and suggesting I Google it, if I wanted to Google it, I would have in the first place.The ability to add apps to have different launchers and themes gives the Android platform an edge over the iphone, IMO. The boasts of the Apple market having more apps means little to me, everything I can think of is available in some form on Android. Seems to me that there is quite a bit of duplication of many apps on both. Having the Adobe preloaded and not having to Root or Jailbreak my phone to have it is also an edge, one that my wife hates.I ordered the High-Quality SlimLine Tough Case in BLACK for the HTC EVO 4G Phone - Slim Design with Chrome Accents for my phone and it doesn't seem to add much bulk but is very sturdy.The only things I didn't care for were the original lock screen and HTC Sense due to lack of features, these were easy fixes with the download of 2 apps, (lockmenu and GO Launcher EX). This phone is far superior to many that I have seen available, I don't need 3D, and Swype works well on the larger keyboard so I don't long for a physical keyboard on the Shift, even without swype, the keyboard is just as good as the iphone. The speaker is loud and clear on both speakerphone and music, the camera is great and has many options for enhancement. The kickstand is a nice plus, but I have only watched one video, so it doesn't get much use.
title: HTC EVO 4G Android Smartphone Sprint - No Warranty

reviewText: My Samsung phone Android experience was slightly different than my HTC Android phone experience. HTC is definitely better, more stable, browsing is better, battery life is worse but the overall quality and the sturdiness of the phone in question is penultimate. Let me try to tell you why I am so enamored by this phone.1. The browsing is excellent, the downloading is quick, the web pages load in seconds and even on 3G the phone is super fast, I have never switched on the 4G for more than an hour and feel it should only be done when you're downloading a very big file. You may wonder what the purpose of 4G is, so well, although the 4G function is there, this phone is faster than any 3G phones available on the network by a mile (Hero, Moment, Optimus S to name a few) So the browsing is excellent.2. I used GPS once while trying to locate a bar a friend of mine was at in downtown. Anyone who's been to downtown manhattan knows what a headache directions are there but using this I got there just in time. Yes, it takes a bit of getting used to and yes if you forget to switch the GPS off, the phone is going to complain and be really hot.3. Of maybe the seven or eight phones I've used in my life time, this one has the loudest speaker when using Pandora. It is very clear at the same time. While the EPIC may have a louder speaker, the Evo has the clear one, for hours at a time I let it play at volume level 2 with the screen switched off and it is the most delightful jukebox. There are several applications for music and the phone's customization and level of speed and concentration is nothing short of excellent. It never confuses between two running apps and multi-tasking is the best on any phone. Credit to Android and HTC Sense developers.4. The kickstand is a unique feature which can be helpful once in a way, the back of the black EVO is smooth and a pleasure to hold in your hands. The QWERTY touchscreen is really good and I have almost mastered it. When I was using the Nexus S, the touchscreen keyboard was awful. The touchscreen on this phone is the best i have seen on any phone. It is maybe better than my ipod touch too which now is a device i never touch. I don't need to use SWYPE cause I'm fast enough holding the phone vertically.5. The alarm feature is just awesome and I had to make a point about it because even if you're listening to music it will give two sounds, one for the music, the other for the alarm, functionality and customization again get a big score here. The NOTIFICATION bar is the best I've seen on any Android phone.6. The BATTERY life is horrid. Worse than Samsung phones. I have a solution that will cost you money. There is a Seidio battery which goes into your phone but doesn't require an extended back. Get that and you will get a day with your phone. With the STOCK BATTERY, there is no use using your phone.7. One of my BIGGEST COMPLAINTS with this phone is the earphone speaker being way too low. When I'm in a busy room full of people, I always have to get up and go out. With my Blackberry or Samsung I never had to this. So yes, this is not the best phone in the world to talk with. It's a very big flaw and makes me dislike the phone immensely. When you plug in headphones, it is loud enough of course but who does that everyday or all the time? not me i guess.8. Ships with 8GB memory, the touchscreen is flawless and never skips a single beat, the phone never freezes and yes, it has restarted itself once or twice since I have had it but I have never had a phone that doesn't ever reboot once in a way so can't complain. I don't use any app killer, at night i keep my brightness to the lowest level, I restart my phone daily to kill any apps running in the background. I use Winamp for playing music. There are several shortcut and widget options. The phone has a beautiful time display, weather display and quite a sense of humor too. The four capacitive buttons always work.The GREEN NOTIFICATION light is friendly and not too urgent like the Blackberry's RED. I know it is silly to compare but I am silly. The camera is just awful to be honest. Though better than the Blackberry, it is still very difficult to take pictures in the night. The flash is too flashy and washes out the face. Netflix runs smooth, I haven't cracked the screen yet but I've seen several cracked Evo's. I didn't bother rooting it or any of that nonsense.Overall, a solid phone with 2 flaws I can live with. I am not going to deduct any marks because the phone has several stand outs.
title: HTC EVO 4G Android Smartphone Sprint - No Warranty
